body_html:
Hi all, I have exactly the same issue: embedding_rnn_seq2seq works fine but embedding_attention_seq2seq gives me segfault when running tensorflow.initialize_all_variables() .

I have enough ram and this segfault happens upon changing batch size, embedding dim or memory dim - for both GRU and LSTM cells.

The core dump tells me
"""
Segfault happened at:07ff864e935b <__memmove_avx_unaligned+427>: mov %esi,(%rdi)
PC (0x07ff864e935b) ok
source "%esi" ok
destination "(%rdi)" (0x00000000) not located in a known VMA region (need writable region)!
"""

It seems like tensorflow is using an uninitialized pointer, but it's not easy to debug where.

I am running tensorflow on i7-6700K and 980-Ti.

Has there been any progress on this? How can I help you solve this issue?

body:
Hi all, I have exactly the same issue: embedding_rnn_seq2seq works fine but embedding_attention_seq2seq gives me segfault when running tensorflow.initialize_all_variables() .

I have enough ram and this segfault happens upon changing batch size, embedding dim or memory dim - for both GRU and LSTM cells.

The core dump tells me 
"""
Segfault happened at:07ff864e935b <__memmove_avx_unaligned+427>: mov %esi,(%rdi)
PC (0x07ff864e935b) ok
source "%esi" ok
destination "(%rdi)" (0x00000000) not located in a known VMA region (need writable region)!
"""

It seems like tensorflow is using an uninitialized pointer, but it's not easy to debug where.

I am running tensorflow on i7-6700K and 980-Ti. 

Has there been any progress on this? How can I help you solve this issue?
